intro: Cacalia lanata, commonly known as the downy cacalia, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Cacalia lanata is a perennial herb that plays a role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining ecological balance in its habitat.
